newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Aguascalientes state says exports booming.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Aguascalientes state says exports booming.

text.p: Aguascalientes, one of Mexico's smallest states, is on course to chalk up $1.6 billion in exports by year-end 1996, the state government said on Thursday.

In a statement, it added that exports from Aguascalientes in 1995 were $1.366 billion, and had posted sharp annual increases since the first year mentioned, 1992, when exports totalled $345 million. The statement did not specify which sectors accounted for the export figures.
Aguascalientes is located northwest of Mexico City, and is home to an expanding auto industry, among others.
